data.title: 这次的更新太愚蠢了！
data.body:
为了提高我的编程效率，所以我选择了vscode。
同时也是出于效率的考虑，我把需要自己常用的函数写进了lua.json里面
因为vscode愚蠢的补全排序，我不得不给自己的函数prefix加上 ` 字符以快速选中它
在今天的版本更新之前，这种做法是有效的
然而今天的更新把这一切都摧毁了！！！

现在即使我在prefix前面加上 ` 字符，也不是默认选中我自己的函数了
诅咒这次更新

- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 (build 7601: sp1)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Used Angular CLI to generate new component but did it in subfolder. 
2. VSCode shows the new folder automatically.
3. From explorer deleted new folder and all generated files.
4. Generated new component again this time in correct folder

I think the file changes on disk should be updated when clicking refresh button in VSCode.

data.title: Broken code commenting in 1.6
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 September update
- OS Version: OSX Mavericks

Previously, while editing JS code in an .html file, it was possible to use the CMD /  keyboard shortcut to comment a line or block of JS code.  Now, it is broken and it inserts HTML comments instead of JS comments.

This is a problem working with Polymer components, because JS and HTML are heavily intermixed in the same .html file.

data.title: Better UX for recommended extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Suggestions for improving the recommended extensions functionality:
1. Whenever I choose the new 'Configure Workspace Recommended Extensions" option, the list of currently installed extensions should be included rather than an empty json array. Adding one by one is really painful.
2. When viewing the list of installed extensions and I click one of them for looking at the details, in the header topbar, next to the [Uninstall] button, there should be another [Recommend] button for automatically adding it to the current workspace.
3. When looking at the list of recommended extensions (filter @recommended:workspace), there should be an 'install all' option.

data.title: Incorrect HTML syntax highlight
data.body:

- OS Version: 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write an HTML file with elements whose tag names contain a `-` character.
2. Only the letters to the left of the `-` is highlighted as the tag name, and other letters, to its right and the `-` itself, is highlighted as if they were attributes.

![10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8168391/19255243/630e81ac-8f8e-11e6-8db3-4a596cad4b4e.png)

data.title: 1.6 Bug with a redirect in preview html
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Mac 10.11.6

As of 1.6 there has been a problem with an extension I am working on where it is not properly reloading the preview pane on content update or when multiple previews are open.

Specifically the first time the provideTextDocumentContent is called, the content that is returned is correctly shown (the string is a simple html page with an embedded script that redirects the page to a local webserver via window.location.href) and the page redirects correctly. 

When the onDidChange emitter is fired and the provideTextDocumentContent is called again, it used to be that the preview pane when once again update with the redirect html and everything worked fine. However, in 1.6 nothing happens once the provideTextDocumentContent is called and the preview pane does not update.

Additionally, when a new document is created with the same TextDocumentContentProvider, the provideTextDocumentContent is called, but it seems as though the preview pane uses the same exact same webview as the first document (not just a copy) because there is no visual reload when switching between the two documents, and everything that happens in one (scrolling, etc) happens to the other. Additionally, the redirect never seems to fire, as the local webserver that would catch the redirect never receives a request (it does on the very first document).

This seems like odd behavior and I've tried looking up the call stack from provideTextDocumentContent to see if I can figure out the problem, however, I haven't been able to track anything down through the promise chain. Let me know if you need any other information.

data.title: C# error detection does not work at all in 1.6
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6

2. Reopened my last project
3. Error detection does literally nothing. I can write "aownrafucktheworldqwerrtoiyl .<[}}#$%}@" in the code, nothing happens, no error detected.
4. Reinstall C# extension - same result.
5. Restart computer - same result.
6. Open any other project - same result
7. Nope, downgrading to 1.5.3, see you next time ...

Regards

- VSCode Version: 1.6.0

2. Change this option by running`vscode.workspace.getConfiguration("editor").update("lineNumbers", "off", true);`
3. The line numbers become relative ones immediately but once you move the cursor, it becomes absolute ones again.
4. Check `settings.json`, the configuration value is already `relative`.

data.title: [decorations] allow positioning of images

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

I have released an alpha of extension `vscode-jumpy` [(marketplace)](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=wmaurer.vscode-jumpy) [(repo)](https://github.com/wmaurer/vscode-jumpy).

I am using `DecorationOption` with `contentIconPath` to display an SVG decoration. However I am unable to have it display below the _baseline_ of the text, as seen here:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2899448/19248999/6b9cf5c0-8f33-11e6-87f1-2caa526f21ac.png)

I have tried many combinations of top and bottom margins and height, but the decoration is never displayed below the baseline, whereas I would like to to extend to the bottom of the _descender_. 

Would it be possible to have this fixed for a future release of VSCode?

data.title: DecorationOptions performance
Multiple extensions registering the 'type' command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install and enable [VSCodeVim](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscodevim.vim) and [vscode-jumpy](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=wmaurer.vscode-jumpy)
2. Open a file with text
3. Run the command `Jumpy Word Mode`. Two letter decorations should appear at the start of each word
4. Type in the two letter code for that word. Jumpy functionality should enact a 'Jump' to the cursor position of that decorator.
5. It doesn't work :-( The keystrokes are being processed by VSCodeVim, not Jumpy.

I am the author of `vscode-jumpy` [(repo)](https://github.com/wmaurer/vscode-jumpy). A user has reported that Jumpy does not work in combination with VSCodeVim: wmaurer/vscode-jumpy#1.

It seems that both extensions are doing a `registerCommand('type')`, but `VSCodeVim` seems to take priority over `vscode-jumpy`. Is there are way to manage which extension has priority, so that it can receive and process the keystrokes? 
Ideally I want to Jumpy to receive and process the next two keystrokes after enabling `Jumpy Word Mode`, but then let the rest of the keystrokes forward to `VSCodeVim`.

data.title: Test: Add commands to scroll to top and bottom of terminal
data.body:
Test for #11135
- [x] Windows @alexandrudima
- [x] Linux @aeschli 
- [x] Mac @joaomoreno 

Test the following commands, their keybindings are supposed to match the default terminal on the platform:

`workbench.action.terminal.scrollToBottom`
- Windows: <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>end</kbd>
- Linux: <kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>end</kbd>
- Mac: <kbd>end</kbd>

`workbench.action.terminal.scrollToTop`
- Windows: <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>home</kbd>
- Linux: <kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>home</kbd>
- Mac: <kbd>home</kbd>

**Important**: Remember if you have set `terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell` in your `settings.json` the key strokes will be consumed by the terminal and not passed to the vscode keybinding handler. You should either remove your custom setting or add the commands to it.

data.title: Windows 10 and  Xming- Not loading
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-insider-1.6.0-1475776934_amd64.tar.gz
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04 and ubuntu 14

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download tar.gz file and extract.  
2. Run "./code &"
   
   I downloaded the tar.gz inside file (code-insider-1.6.0-1475776934_amd64.tar.gz). I extracted it and ran "./code-insiders"

I got

gmalenko@ubuntu:~/VSCode-linux-x64$ ./code-insiders
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
[xcb] Unknown sequence number while processing queue
[xcb] Most likely this is a multi-threaded client and XInitThreads has not been called
[xcb] Aborting, sorry about that.
ome/gmalenko/VSCode-linux-x64/code-insiders: ../../src/xcb_io.c:274: poll_for_event: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_threads_sequence_lost' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)

I'm going to do the deb file and see how it goes

Installed deb file. Run "code-insiders" from the command prompt and nothing really happens. It appears that a process does start

gmalenko@ubuntu:~/VSCode-linux-x64$ ps -aux | grep code
gmalenko 24259 18.0 5.2 866912 53000 ? Ssl 14:46 0:00 /usr/share/cod -insiders/code-insiders
gmalenko 24261 2.5 2.9 309164 30080 ? S 14:46 0:00 /usr/share/cod -insiders/code-insiders --type=zygote --no-sandbox
gmalenko 24265 0.0 0.0 14224 932 pts/0 S+ 14:46 0:00 grep --color=auto code
